result.execSummary:
The defendant Howard D Eskridge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).
  • Exposing genitals to a child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: period of imprisonment deft is currently serving

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.

No contact with A.C.P (12/18/98). 

No contact with females under the age of 18 unless authorized by agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department. 

DNA sample. 

Comply with sex offender rules.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:23 am 
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Andrew Martinez. 
Atty Martinez makes statement - notes mistake in previous agreement and notes parties have reach an agreement to fix that mistake. 

Deft withdraws plea to Ct. 2 (Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex Activity/Repeater). 
COURT allows deft to withdraw plea to Ct. 2. 
State to e-file amended information. 

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

PLEA: Ct. 2 (Mental Harm to Child)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 2>>SWH for 3 years probation - to run CONSECUTIVE to period of imprisonment deft is currently serving - CONDITIONS: no contact with A.C.P. (12/18/1998); no contact with females under the age of 18 unless authorized by agent; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; comply with sex offender rules; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample/surcharge; CC. 

All other convictions and sentences to remain the same.

from Dane County Jail

Ct. 2>>SWH for 3 years probation - to run CONSECUTIVE to ES. 
Ct. 3>>SWH for 3 years probation - to run CONCURRENT to ES (to start today). 
Ct. 4>>1 year MCJ with 379 days jail credit. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of Probation>>no contact with A.C.P. (12/18/1998); no contact with females under the age of 18 unless authorized by agent; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; comply with sex offender rules; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample/surcharge; CC.

Case Called: 9:15 am 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty John Bachman. 
Date and time set for hearing on Atty Bachman's motion to withdraw. 
Atty Bachman makes statement - notes deft does NOT wish to have another public defender attorney appointed at this time and wishes to attempt to hire his own attorney. 
COURT grants motion to withdraw and directs Atty Bachman to contact public defender's office and have them appoint a new attorney. 
COURT notes matter is set for jury trial next week - parties state jury trial is NOT a speedy trial demand. 
COURT notes request for bond modification. 
Deft makes statement. 
Argument re: bond modification. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT denies motion for bond modification. 
COURT warns deft re: continuing to fire attorneys and possibility of deft having to proceed without counsel. 
COURT removes jury trial set for 8/16/16 and FPT set for 8/12/16 from calendar. 
CC set for 8/24/2016 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA to set future dates.
